message_1:
Consider the simplicial complex K consisting of the vertices {v1, v2, v3, v4} and the triangles {v1, v2, v3}, {v2, v3, v4}, and {v1, v3, v4}. 

What is the dimension of K?
message_2: The dimension of a simplicial complex is determined by the highest-dimensional simplex in the complex. In this case, the highest-dimensional simplices are the triangles, which are 2-dimensional. Therefore, the dimension of the simplicial complex K is 2.
